front.title: Border Gateway Protocol 4 (BGP-4) Send Hold Timer

abstract.t:
This document defines the SendHoldTimer session attribute for the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Finite State Machine (FSM). A session should be terminated if the TCP receive window is zero for the duration of the Hold Timer, in this situation the peer is expected to terminate the connection. For robustness, this document specifies that the local system should also close the connection.
This document updates RFC4271.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines the SendHoldTimer session attribute for the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Finite State Machine (FSM) defined in section 8. A session should be terminated if the TCP receive window is zero for the duration of the Hold Timer, in this situation the peer is expected to terminate the connection. For robustness, this document specifies that the local system should also close the connection.

The BGP runs over TCP it is possible for hosts in ESTABLISHED state to encounter a peer that is advertising a zero windows size and preventing KEEPALIVE, CEASE, WITHDRAW, UPDATE and other critical messages from being sent.

Since implementations themselves do not have a way to handle this, this often results in a Denial Of Service either to handling messages or delivering reachablity information to other peers.
This phenomena is theorised to have contributed to IP traffic backholing events in global Internet routing system.

section.title: Changes to RFC 4271
section.t: In section 8 BGP Finite State Machine (FSM) . The following mandatory session attributes are added
OLD: 6.5. Hold Timer Expired Error Handling

If a system does not receive successive KEEPALIVE, UPDATE, and/or NOTIFICATION messages within the period specified in the Hold Time field of the OPEN message, then the NOTIFICATION message with the Hold Timer Expired Error Code is sent and the BGP connection is closed.
NEW: 6.5. Hold Timer Expired Error Handling

If a system does not send and receive successive KEEPALIVE, UPDATE, and/or NOTIFICATION messages within the period specified in the Hold Time field of the open message, then the BGP connection is closed and a log message is emitted.
